oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Decatur County Courthouse
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Front of the exterior of the second Decatur County Courthouse. The two-story brick building has four square columns, a pediment, windows with shutters, and several chimneys.

The original Decatur County courthouse was a cabin that burned down in 1869. After this, a committee, consisting of J.W. Mayo, W.C. Fryar, D.M. Scott, and others, decided to replace it with a two-story brick courthouse. An arsonist, motivated to destroy all the records held in the courthouse, burned the building down in 1927.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Courthouses--Tennessee; Public buildings--Tennessee
Courthouses
